intro: Ormosia larecajana, commonly known as the Larecajá tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree produces hard, woody pods that contain flat, elongated seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Ormosia larecajana plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various forest organisms.
